text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to maintain good credit?
text.Response A: I can give you some general advice about how to keep your credit in good standing.  First, make sure to always pay your bills on time.  Second, don’t take out more credit than you can afford to pay back.  Third, check your credit report regularly to make sure there aren’t any errors on it.  Finally, don’t close any credit accounts, since that can negatively impact your credit score.
text.Response B:
Review your credit score.
Know what your credit score means.
Improve the credit score factors that you can.
Know when to ask for help.
Don’t use all your credit.
Take out credit slowly.
Diversify your debt.
Keep using the same accounts.
Don’t obsess over your credit score.

656.displayed_text:
Prompt

Can you tell me how to maintain good credit?

Response A

I can give you some general advice about how to keep your credit in good standing. First, make sure to always pay your bills on time. Second, don’t take out more credit than you can afford to pay back. Third, check your credit report regularly to make sure there aren’t any errors on it. Finally, don’t close any credit accounts, since that can negatively impact your credit score.

Response B

Review your credit score.
Know what your credit score means.
Improve the credit score factors that you can.
Know when to ask for help.
Don’t use all your credit.
Take out credit slowly.
Diversify your debt.
Keep using the same accounts.
Don’t obsess over your credit score.
